 We are looking for a highly skilled ServiceNow Specialist with extensive knowledge in modules primarily HRSD, ITSM, and Service Portal to our office in Stockholm. The ideal candidate will have hands-on experience in analyzing, designing, developing/writing, and managing ServiceNow applications, with recent implementation experience in the HRSD module.
   

  

**The role**
 In this role, you will translate business requirements into technical specifications and create deliverables in different phases of the project life-cycle by decomposing functionality into specifications and business rules. You will produce business requirement documents (BRD), functional specifications, and business process flows. You will analyze business processes and perform gap analysis, impact analysis, and feasibility studies.
   

  

 You will liaise with onsite/offsite development teams on a daily basis to monitor project progress by tracking activity, resolving problems, publishing progress reports, and recommending actions. You will gather business requirements by interfacing with internal and external stakeholders and conduct analysis for application development. Additionally, you will facilitate requirement workshops.
   

  

 A detailed knowledge of Service Desk processes and ITIL standards is essential. You should have experience with ServiceNow implementation and knowledge in ServiceNow Orchestration. Good knowledge of ServiceNow Plugins, along with strong communication, presentation, and client handling skills, is required. Proficiency in Java Scripting and hands-on experience with ITIL process implementation is also necessary.
   

  

 You will be responsible for custom application design and development on the ServiceNow platform, with hands-on design, development, and deployment experience. You should be adept at creating required information for reporting and dashboards.
   

  

  
   

  

**Technical Expertise**
* Knowledge in HRSD Life Cycle, ITSM
* Customisation and Administration of ServiceNow Core Modules
* ServiceNow Client side and Server Side Scripting.
* Data importing using Import Sets (Data Source/Import Sets/Transform Maps)
* Service portal knowledge.
* Administration and creation of interactive portals.
* Strong in ITIL processes.
* ServiceNow Orchestration
* Provide software configuration and customization including, but not limited to: screen tailoring, workflow administration, report setup, data imports, integration, custom scripting and third party software integrations
* Obtain and analyze business requirements and document technical solutions
* Develop, design and rollout new application modules, workflows and catalog requests
* Research new functionality and recommend solutions that deliver customer value


**Preferred Skills**
* Understanding of Configuration Management as it relates to ITIL
* Web Services Integration (SOAP, REST, and JSON)
* Experience implementing systems using the Agile/Scrum methodology
* Experienced in the System Development Life Cycle (SDLC) processes including customer requirement analysis and system design
* Administration of a ServiceNow instance including the delegation of groups, modification of CMS, workflows, business rules, UI actions, UI policies, ACLs, dictionary, catalog items and updates of all other existing solutions requiring revisions
* ITIL certification is a plus
* RSD ServiceNow Implementer Certification is a plus


**Candidates Should Demonstrate Experience In The Following Areas**
* Design and delivery of technical solutions based on the ServiceNow platform
* Leadership skills in technical initiatives
* Generating detailed documentation
* Communications that clearly articulate solutions and the ability to perform demonstrations


**Language**
 Fluent in both English and Swedish, written as verbal.

title: Business Analyst inom försäkring
description:
Beskrivning av tjänsten
   

  

 På CGI ligger vi i framkant när det kommer till digitalisering och tillämpning av nya teknologier. Just nu söker vi medarbetare som delar vår passion och som har en erfarenhet inom affärsutveckling.
   

  

 Vi söker en engagerad och erfaren Business Analyst med teknisk bakgrund inom Försäkring som kommer att fortsätta leda framgångsrika projekt för våra kunder, samtidigt som du stärker vårt team med dina erfarenheter och insikter.
   

  

 Dina framtida arbetsuppgifter
   

  

 I rollen som Business Analyst kommer du att ha en central roll i att stödja och utveckla våra IT-projekt och verksamhetsprojekt inom försäkringsbranschen. Din roll kommer att vara starkt kundinriktad, där du analyserar affärsbehov och formar skräddarsydda lösningar för att uppfylla deras krav.
   

  

 Kvalifikationer för att bli framgångsrik denna roll
   

  

 Du är en initiativtagande person som trivs i en snabbväxande miljö. Som en del av vårt team förväntas du vara självgående men samtidigt en lagspelare. Du har utmärkta kommunikationsfärdigheter och en naturlig fallenhet för problemlösning.
   

  

 Vi tror att du har en bakgrund inom datavetenskap, systemvetenskap eller liknande och har mellan 3-5 års erfarenhet inom försäkringsbranschen. Vidare har du god kännedom kring regelverken som styr försäkringsbolagens verksamhet (tex DORA, FIDA). Du har arbetat med databaser eller ETL-processer och är väl bevandrad inom SAFe.
   

  

**Det är extra meriterande om du har kunskap eller erfarenhet av följande teknologier**
* Generative AI /automation
* AI/RPA
* DataManagement / strategy
* Core insurance lösningar som tex Lumera, Sapiens Guidewire


 Om du söker dig till en arbetsplats som utmanar, utvecklar och hjälper dig vidare i din professionella karriär så är CGI rätt plats för dig. Ansök nu för att utforska möjligheten att vara en del av vårt spännande team inom Försäkringar!
   

  

 Har du frågor om tjänsten är du välkommen att höra av dig till rekryterande chef Susann Edvardsson på Susann.Edvardsson@cgi.com
   

  

**Låt oss som ägare omvandla verklig insikt till handling – tillsammans.**
 Livet på CGI bygger på ägande, lagarbete, respekt och tillhörighet. Tillsammans med oss kommer du att kunna nå din fulla potential.
   

  

 Du är inbjuden att ta ägandeskap redan från första dagen i vårt arbete med att förverkliga vår dröm om att skapa en arbetsmiljö där vi trivs med att arbeta tillsammans och bidrar till framgången för vårt företag. Det är därför vi kallar oss CGI Partners snarare än anställda. Vi drar nytta av vår kollektiva framgång och tillsammans får vi möjlighet att aktivt forma vår företagsstrategi och inriktning.
   

  

 Ditt arbete skapar värde. Du kommer att vara med att utveckla innovativa lösningar och bygga relationer med medarbetare och kunder samtidigt som du får tillgång till globala möjligheter att skala upp dina idéer, omfamna nya möjligheter och dra nytta av gedigen bransch- och teknikexpertis.
   

  

 Du kommer att forma din karriär tillsammans med ett företag som är byggt för att växa och bestå. Du får stöd av ledare som bryr sig om din hälsa och ditt välbefinnande och ger dig möjligheter att fördjupa dina kunskaper och vidga dina vyer.
   

  

 Bli en del en av världens största leverantörer av IT- och affärskonsulttjänster.

title: Customer Technology Advisor - Application Services (Nordics)
job_function: Sales, Business Development, and Customer Service
description:
**Who We Are**
 At Kyndryl, we design, build, manage and modernize the mission-critical technology systems that the world depends on every day. So why work at Kyndryl? We are always moving forward – always pushing ourselves to go further in our efforts to build a more equitable, inclusive world for our employees, our customers and our communities.
   

  

**The Role**
 Join our dynamic team as a Customer Technology Advisor and become an integral part of our cutting-edge Go-To-Market team. As a certified expert in your field, you will be at the forefront of revolutionizing technology solutions for our valued customers. Working hand in hand with our Kyndryl Consult Partners and customer partners, you will leverage your technical and solution expertise to drive targeted opportunities and exceed customer expectations.
   

  

 In this role, you won't just be another advisor; you will be a trusted ally and visionary, delivering unique and differentiated value to our customers. Through captivating show-and-tell methods such as engaging demos and compelling presentations, you will showcase our credibility and eminence in the industry, leaving a lasting impression on potential customers.
   

  

 As a vital member of our team, you will support Consulting, Advisory, and Architecture activities across Sales, Pre-Sales & Delivery, collaborating closely with Customer Partners and Kyndryl Consult Partners. With your extensive technical knowledge and mastery of the practice-specific domain, you will bring together the breadth of Kyndryl's expertise to develop profitable deals that drive our success.
   

  

 Your dedication to continuous improvement and your passion for our practice will shine through as you showcase your end-to-end knowledge of the domain you align with, as well as the associated subdomains. Your technical prowess, backed by your external certifications, will establish you as a true authority in your field.
   

  

 As a Customer Technology Advisor, you will possess strong technical and business acumen, allowing you to provide value driven solutions within the practice services domain(s). Your exceptional customer facing skills, combined with your articulate communication style and interpersonal finesse, will enable you to effortlessly convey the technical benefits of Kyndryl's capabilities, perfectly matching the unique needs of each customer.
   

  

 As a strategic thinker, you will identify the intricate business and technical requirements of our customers, leveraging the vast capabilities of Kyndryl to generate winning cross-practice solutions. Your ability to develop and deliver compelling demonstrations, proof of concepts, and prototypes will clearly demonstrate the tangible value our offerings bring to our customers, leaving them eager to partner with us.
   

  

 In addition to your technical expertise, you will also take the lead in coordinating the entire pre-sales process, ensuring quality and compliance verification while adhering to Kyndryl best practices. Your collaboration with internal and external stakeholders will generate winning responses and create optimal technical solutions. Moreover, you will actively build and nurture relationships with our external alliance partners, fostering a collaborative environment where joint solutions are co-created.
   

  

 Join our team of forward thinking, tech-savvy professionals and embark on a journey of innovation, growth, and fulfillment. As a Customer Technology Advisor, you will not only shape the future of technology solutions but also make a meaningful impact on the success of our customers and Kyndryl as a whole.
   

  

 Your Future at Kyndryl
   

  

 Every position at Kyndryl offers a way forward to grow your career. We have opportunities that you won’t find anywhere else, including hands-on experience, learning opportunities, and the chance to certify in all four major platforms. Whether you want to broaden your knowledge base or narrow your scope and specialize in a specific sector, you can find your opportunity here.
   

  

**Who You Are**
 You’re good at what you do and possess the required experience to prove it. However, equally as important – you have a growth mindset; keen to drive your own personal and professional development. You are customer-focused – someone who prioritizes customer success in their work. And finally, you’re open and borderless – naturally inclusive in how you work with others.
   

  

**Required Skills And Experience**
* Deep domain knowledge of Services offerings and technical solutions in a practice
* Demonstrated experience translating distinctive technical knowledge into actionable customer insights and solutions
* Prior consultative selling experience
* Externally recognized as an expert in the technology and/or solutioning areas, including technical certifications supporting subdomain focus area(s) including: Application Data and AI; Cloud; Core Enterprise and zCloud; Digital Workplace; Network and Edge; Security and Resiliency


**Preferred Skills And Experience**
* Bachelor's degree or Master’s degree
* 5 years of experience (minimum) selling technical services for multi-industry customers


**Being You**
 Diversity is a whole lot more than what we look like or where we come from, it’s how we think and who we are. We welcome people of all cultures, backgrounds, and experiences. But we’re not doing it single-handily: Our Kyndryl Inclusion Networks are only one of many ways we create a workplace where all Kyndryls can find and provide support and advice. This dedication to welcoming everyone into our company means that Kyndryl gives you – and everyone next to you – the ability to bring your whole self to work, individually and collectively, and support the activation of our equitable culture. That’s the Kyndryl Way.
   

  

**What You Can Expect**
 With state-of-the-art resources and Fortune 100 clients, every day is an opportunity to innovate, build new capabilities, new relationships, new processes, and new value. Kyndryl cares about your well-being and prides itself on offering benefits that give you choice, reflect the diversity of our employees and support you and your family through the moments that matter – wherever you are in your life journey. Our employee learning programs give you access to the best learning in the industry to receive certifications, including Microsoft, Google, Amazon, Skillsoft, and many more. Through our company-wide volunteering and giving platform, you can donate, start fundraisers, volunteer, and search over 2 million non-profit organizations. At Kyndryl, we invest heavily in you, we want you to succeed so that together, we will all succeed.
   

  

**Get Referred!**
 If you know someone that works at Kyndryl, when asked ‘How Did You Hear About Us’ during the application process, select ‘Employee Referral’ and enter your contact's Kyndryl email address.

title: Public Cloud Consultant Microsoft
description:
Join a dynamic team at the forefront of Microsoft Cloud services, where you'll design, implement, and manage cutting-edge Azure solutions, collaborate with talented professionals, and grow your career with personalized development plans and access to top-tier certifications.
   

  

**This is what makes the position as Public Cloud Consultant Microsoft unique**
* Take ownership as a technical Lead in a specialized service area, shaping strategic solutions and driving innovation
* Cutting-Edge Technology Exposure: Work hands-on with Microsoft Cloud technologies like Azure, Power Platform, and DevOps, keeping you at the forefront of industry advancements
* Access personalized career development, Microsoft certifications, and holistic well-being support, ensuring both professional and personal success


 As a Senior Azure Engineer, you will work with delivery projects, maintenance, development, and life cycle management of our Managed Services platforms. The position also includes 3rd line level support, incident handling, change and problem management related to our European Portfolio under Cloud Services e.g. Azure Operate, Azure Migrate, Landing Zone and Azure Ready Assessment.
   

  

 My name is Heidi Storm, Head of Microsoft Cloud Services. As a leader, I am dedicated and transparent, always championing a "Win as a Team" mentality. I believe in fostering a welcoming, supportive, and solution-oriented environment where everyone can grow, collaborate, and make a real impact.
   

  

**Your role & influence as Public Cloud Consultant** 
**Microsoft**
*Responsibility* 
 : You will be given responsibility for designing, implementing, and managing scalable cloud architectures using Microsoft Azure, while collaborating with development teams to enhance cloud-based services, automate operations, and ensure optimal performance and reliability.
   

  

*Collaboration* 
 : Together with your team, you take care of delivering our Standardized Services efficiently and effectively. You'll work closely not only with your immediate team members but also with the Sales Engineers, Project Managers, and Service Offerings teams to ensure seamless implementation and customer success.
   

  

**Core Activities**
* Collaborating with cross-functional teams, including Sales Engineers, Project Managers, and Service Offerings teams, to develop, maintain, and successfully deliver customer projects
* Providing 3rd line support by handling incidents, managing changes, and solving complex problems within the European Portfolio to ensure seamless service delivery
* Developing and maintaining internal support tools to optimize workflows, streamline project deployments, and assist consultants in delivering high-quality solutions


**Benefits Of Joining Dustin**
 We believe there's more to Dustin than just the benefits listed here. You'll fully understand this once you're with us.
   

  

**You can find more of our benefits below in the vacancy.**
****This is what we imagine you bring****
 We envision you as a curious and driven individual who is passionate about Microsoft cloud technologies, thrives in a collaborative environment, and enjoys solving complex technical challenges to deliver high-quality solutions.
   

  

**Additionally, It's Important That You Have**
* A bachelor's degree level of working and thinking
* 5+ years of experience in Microsoft cloud solutions, with a focus on Microsoft Azure, Power Platform, and Microsoft server infrastructure
* A strong understanding of Azure services, including Virtual Machines, Azure DevOps, Azure Kubernetes Service, Azure networking, Azure Backup, and Azure Firewall
* Experience with infrastructure as code using ARM templates
* Knowledge of identity services like Windows Active Directory, Entra ID, and Entra ID domain services
* Proficient in English, as it is the main language used for all internal and external communications. Additionally, proficiency in one of the local languages spoken in Dustin’s operating countries (Danish, Norwegian, Swedish, Dutch, Finnish, or French) is a plus


****What can you expect next?****
 To Ensure a Fair Recruitment Process Free From Unconscious Bias, We Handle Your Application Anonymously And Do Not Accept Cover Letters. Please Refrain From Sending One, So That The Selection Is Based Solely On Professional Competencies. We Expect The Following Steps In The Recruitment Process
   

  

* Telephone screening with the recruiter Elza van Grootel- Coenraats
* 1st interview with Heidi Storm
* 2nd interview with Technical Lead from the team & Heidi Storm
* 3rd interview with Jonas Sjöberg (Director for Managed Services)


 For questions about the position, please contact the TA Partner Elza van Grootel- Coenraats via e-mail

title: Senior Active Directory Specialist
description:
Har du gedigen erfarenhet av att drifta och utveckla Active Directory i affärskritiska miljöer med höga krav på säkerhet och tillgänglighet? Vi söker en senior specialist inom IAM med fokus på Active Directory, som vill vara en del av ett team som arbetar med hela accessområdet. Vill du dessutom arbeta med teknik i framkant inom försvarsindustrin? Nu har du chansen att bli en del av att bidra till säkerheten i Sverige och världen.
   

  

 Denna tjänst i Alvik börjar som ett konsultuppdrag men tanken är att den senare ska gå över i en anställning hos vår kund.
   

  

 Som konsult på Centric får du en trygg anställning och samlar på dig värdefull arbetslivserfarenhet på uppdrag hos våra kunder. Din konsultchef stöttar dig i din utveckling där du hela tiden fyller på med nya erfarenheter och kunskaper. En utmärkt möjlighet att göra karriär.
   

  

**Dina arbetsuppgifter** 
 I rollen som Senior Active Directory Specialist kommer du att ansvara för att säkerställa en stabil och säker AD-miljö genom kontinuerlig drift, övervakning och patchning. Du kommer att arbeta med härdning och säkerhetskonfigurering av Active Directory, hantera behörigheter och delegation samt bidra med expertis i IAM-relaterade frågeställningar. Vidare ingår felsökning och incidenthantering, samt uppsättning och drift av viss infrastruktur.
   

  

 Du kommer även att arbeta proaktivt för att förbättra och effektivisera processer, dokumentation och automatisering, där scripting i PowerShell är en naturlig del av arbetet.
   

  

**Din profil och kvalifikationer** 
 För att lyckas i rollen ser vi att du har en gedigen bakgrund inom Microsofts ekosystem, med djupgående kunskap inom Azure, Microsoft Defender och PowerShell. Du har en förståelse för moderna DevOps-principer och hur nätverksinfrastrukturer i molnet är uppbyggda.
   

  

 Som person är du nyfiken och engagerad, med en stark vilja att hålla dig uppdaterad inom nya teknologier och säkerhetslösningar. Du har en god kommunikationsförmåga och trivs med att samarbeta i team, samtidigt som du kan arbeta självständigt och driva projekt framåt.
   

  

**Krav**
* Flerårig erfarenhet av systemadministration i Active Directory
* Djup kunskap inom IAM och identitetshantering
* Förståelse för infrastruktur, nätverk och systemadministration
* Erfarenhet av modern IT-drift, gärna med GitOps-tänk
* Avancerade kunskaper i PowerShell och scripting


 Erfarenhet av automatisering i större skala är meriterande.
   

  

**Vad vi erbjuder** 
 På Centric får du de verktyg du behöver för att nå dina mål. Vi erbjuder alla våra konsulter kvalificerade utbildningar och certifieringar inom den senaste tekniken. Vi tycker nämligen att våra medarbetare hela tiden ska fortsätta att utvecklas. Därför erbjuder vi dig möjligheten att lägga upp en individuell utbildningsplan, där vi bekostar såväl studiematerial som själva certifieringarna. Under din utveckling kommer vi matcha din kompetens mot rätt uppdrag i takt med att du avancerar. Vi genomför regelbundet spännande aktiviteter där du som konsult får möjlighet att träffa och umgås med dina kollegor under roliga och avslappnande former.
   

  

*Mer om oss*
 Centric är ett IT-företag med 370 anställda, med kontor i Stockholm, Göteborg, Malmö och Linköping. Vi specialiserar oss på uthyrning av generalister och förmedling av specialister samt erbjuder outsourcing och systemlösningar inom retail. Vi är medlem i Almega Kompetensföretagen och följer deras tecknade kollektivavtal med Unionen.

title: Tech Lead Monitorering
description:
Bankgirot söker nu en Tech Lead Monitorering till en växande del av organisationen i Stockholm.
   

  

 Arbetet med att utveckla framtidens betalningsinfrastruktur är i full gång och vi behöver dig som vill vara en del av resan. Som Tech Lead Monitorering får du en nyckelroll i att bygga upp observability-området– med ett tydligt uppdrag att bidra till en robust, säker och framtidssäkrad drift.
   

  

**Din roll**
 Vi står inför en omfattande förändringsresa där en helt ny infrastruktur byggs upp parallellt med den befintliga. I rollen som Tech Lead Monitorering är du med och definierar hur övervakning och systeminsyn ska fungera i den nya miljön. Du kombinerar strategiskt perspektiv med praktisk implementation och utvecklar tekniska lösningar och arbetssätt med fokus på stabilitet, säkerhet och hög tillgänglighet.
   

  

 Med ett helhetsperspektiv på vårt systemlandskap etablerar du effektiva verktyg, processer och strukturer för en proaktiv och sammanhängande observability-miljö. Rollen är både operativ och vägledande – du bidrar med din expertis, driver tekniska initiativ och stöttar team och organisation i att bygga förmåga och kunskap inom området.
   

  

 Dina huvudsakliga ansvarsområden omfattar bl a
   

  

  

* Design och implementering av observability-lösningar inklusive logghantering, metrics, spårning och incidenthantering – med hjälp av verktyg som Prometheus, Grafana, ELK eller Datadog.
* Leda och koordinera tekniska initiativ samt etablera arbetssätt, riktlinjer och struktur för effektiv övervakning av applikationer och infrastruktur.
* Fungera som länk mellan teknikteam, drift, utveckling och verksamhet – med fokus på att lösningarna möter affärsmål, SLA:er och säkerhetskrav.
* Bygga upp kompetens inom området genom coachning, utbildning och samarbete med både interna team och externa leverantörer.


**Vem är du**
 Vi söker dig med bred erfarenhet inom IT och djup kompetens inom observability. Du har arbetat i komplexa systemlandskap, gärna i samband med modernisering, plattformsförflyttningar eller Greenfield-initiativ, och har förmågan att växla mellan helhetsperspektiv och tekniskt djup.
   

  

 Du har god vana av att arbeta med moderna verktyg och plattformar för övervakning och logghantering. Att utforma effektiva observability-lösningar i distribuerade systemmiljöer är en naturlig del av din vardag, liksom att analysera data och bidra till snabb och träffsäker incidenthantering.
   

  

 Informationssäkerhet är något du har god förståelse för – inte minst när det gäller hantering av loggar och känsliga data – och du ser till att både tekniken och arbetssätten möter dessa krav.
   

  

**Mer information och ansökan**
 I denna rekrytering samarbetar Bankgirot med Nexer Recruit.
   

  

 Har du frågor eller funderingar? Kontakta gärna rekryteringskonsult Johanna Värmfors: johanna.varmfors@nexergroup.com eller +46 730 821 230.
   

  

 Läs mer om tjänsten och ansök här.
   

  

 Välkommen med din ansökan!
   

  

 Bankgirot är ett svenskt clearinghus och teknikbolag med över 60 års erfarenhet av att leverera finansiell infrastruktur till banker. I samverkan med betalsektorn ser vi till att privatpersoner och företag enkelt kan göra överföringar och betalningar. Bankgirot säkerställer att det nuvarande betalsystemet fungerar felfritt, samtidigt som vi utvecklar framtidssäkrade lösningar. Vi säkrar och utvecklar Sveriges betalningar.
   

  

 Läs mer på www.bankgirot.se

title: Technical Lead / Lösningsarkitekt
description:
**Om oss** 




  





 Valtech, som nyligen förvärvade Kin + Carta, är ett ledande digitalt transformationsföretag som strävar efter att skapa bättre sätt att uppleva världen. Med över 6,500 medarbetare på mer än 60 kontor globalt hjälper vi varumärken att frigöra värde i en snabbt digitaliserad värld. Vi samarbetar med några av världens mest framstående företag, likaväl som lokala aktörer på den svenska marknaden och fokuserar på att utveckla innovativa lösningar som förbättrar både kundupplevelser och affärsprocesser.
 



  





**Rollen** 




  





 Vi söker en
 **Tech Lead / Solution Architect** 
 som har djup teknisk expertis och erfarenhet inom plattformsimplementering, särskilt med verktyg som
 **Optimizely** 
 . Du kommer att arbeta nära våra kunder och interna team för att designa, implementera och optimera digitala lösningar. Du bör vara baserad i Stockholm och kunna arbeta från vårt kontor 2–3 dagar per vecka.
 



  





**Arbetsuppgifter** 




  




* Leda och delta i kundprojekt från förförsäljning och upptäckt till leverans, i samarbete med både lokala och globala team.
* Engagera både IT- och affärsintressenter för att skräddarsy lösningar som skapar affärsnytta.
* Designa och implementera skalbara och hållbara lösningar för CMS-projekt.
* Leda tvärfunktionella team för att integrera komplexa backend-system, inklusive CMS och externa tjänster.
* Bidra med tekniskt ledarskap och mentorskap för utvecklingsteam, samt främja en kultur av innovation och kvalitet.
* Aktivt identifiera och åtgärda tekniska utmaningar och flaskhalsar för att säkerställa optimal prestanda och effektivitet.
* Hålla dig uppdaterad om de senaste trenderna och teknologierna inom digital transformation.



  





**Din Bakgrund** 




  




* Minst 10 års erfarenhet av backend-utveckling, med särskilt fokus på Optimizely CMS. Erfarenhet av eCommerce-plattformar är ett plus.
* Goda kunskaper inom .NET / .NET Core (C#), API-driven utveckling samt Privacy by Design.
* Erfarenhet av molnplattformar, främst Azure, och god förståelse för DevOps-principer.
* Erfarenhet av databasdesign och utveckling (inklusive SQL).
* Du är van vid att hantera kundrelationer och identifiera ytterligare sätt för att skapa värde genom tekniska lösningar.
* Erfarenhet av att leda och designa arkitekturen för företagslösningar.



  





**Vad kan du förvänta dig hos oss?** 




  





 På Valtech kommer du att bli en del av ett kreativt och innovativt team som strävar efter att göra skillnad genom våra lösningar. Vi ger dig möjlighet att ta stort ansvar, vara en nyckelperson i vårt globala team och leda förändring. Vi värdesätter innovation, samarbete och frihet under ansvar. Hos oss får du kontinuerliga möjligheter att utvecklas och bidra till den globala tekniska utvecklingen.
 



  





**Är du redo att ta nästa steg?** 




  





 Vi söker en driven och engagerad person som vill vara med och forma framtidens digitala lösningar. Om detta låter som en spännande möjlighet för dig, ansök idag! Vi ser fram emot att höra från dig och diskutera hur du kan bidra till vår resa.
 



  





**Välkommen till Valtech!**

title: SAP Sourcing & Procurement consultant
description:
Do you have a passion for transforming businesses with the newest technologies and making them data-driven companies? Are you looking for a place where you could combine your business consulting skills with technology strategy know-how? Then our roles as SAP Sourcing & Procurement consultant in our SAP Business Group are a perfect find for you!
   

  

 Bring your talent and passion to Accenture and help us deliver on the promise of technology and human ingenuity. Take this opportunity to develop your skills and build an extraordinary career. You will play a key role in transforming organizations and communities around the world. Let there be change!
   

  

**About Our Nordic SAP Business Group**
 Accenture and SAP have a longstanding relationship that extends more than 40 years. As the leading Nordic and Global SAP transformation partner, we work with SAP end-to-end from product innovation to development and delivery. Together, we are revolutionizing the future of business through major SAP S/4 HANA driven business transformation programs with several of the biggest companies.
   

  

 Within our Nordic SAP community, we work with the newest SAP solutions and offerings such as SAP S/4 HANA Cloud, Ariba, Icertis, SAP BTP and SAP RISE. Our proven delivery methods inclde preconfigured industry template and embrace new capabilities introduced by AI .
   

  

 We are now looking to expand our community at scale and are looking at experienced candidates for several positions and seniority levels.
   

  

 To read more about our SAP Practice, visit us at https://www.accenture.com/us-en/services/sap-index
   

  

**What’s in it for you:**
- Work with some of the biggest SAP clients in large global implementation projects.

- Be an integral part of innovative SAP transformation projects.

- Significant development opportunities and support for progressing in your professional career.

- Rich opportunities to develop your business acumen, consulting toolbox, technical and professional skills.

- Access to comprehensive tools and frameworks supported by our global organization, including implementation methodologies, knowledge databases, industry leading add-on software, expert network and benchmarks.

- A dedicated mentor to guide you during your work with continuous feedback.

- Being part of our culture and core values in a truly human work environment.

- Utilize your functional and technical expertise in SAP, by analyzing, designing, and implementing business processes supported by SAP best practice solutions.

- Utilize your Industry expertise in the field of SAP solutions to deliver client value as a professional individual and as part of a team.

- Take part in our highly engaged and diverse global network, for collaboration and delivery.

- Competitive compensation and benefits.

- Help clients’ sustainability agenda through SAP transformations.

- Be a valuable member of our Nordic SAP Smart Procurement Value Tower and contribute to thought leadership, competence development, and sales initiatives.

**SAP Smart Procurement Nordic Value Tower**
 The sourcing & procurement function is shifting. Traditionally driven and managed by deep and complex processes, their future must become digital, data driven and automated. Helping our clients to succeed in this transformation journey is what we thrive for.
   

  

 SAP Smart Procurement Value Tower is one out of 10 different process specialization communities within our Nordic SAP Business Group.
   

  

 We work hand in hand with our procurement strategy colleagues and our global delivery centers.
   

  

 Our cross-Nordics team designs and configure sourcing & procurement processes in S/4 HANA, Ariba upstream and downstream processes and Fieldglass - and we excel both in large, global S/4 HANA engagements (from smart brownfield through full business transformations) as well as in more focused multi-step process capability deployments.
   

  

**Required Qualifications**
- Min. 3 years of hands-on SAP S/4 HANA sourcing & procurement experience as consultant from at least two S/4HANA projects (preferably in the Nordics)

- Based in Nordics or EU, with either EU citizenship or valid work permit

- Good understanding of sourcing and procurement business processes and their key value drivers

- Eagerness to shape and work in a team-oriented environment

- Motivated, persistent, eager to optimize, drive for excellence

- Passionate about SAP, innovation and delivery of the latest technologies to your clients

- Effectively work with cross-functional teams/stakeholders in an international and fast-moving environment

- Strong analytical skills, result-oriented paired with highly structured working style and good sense of responsibility, flexibility, and team player

- Excellent communication (verbal and written) and presentation skills to address technical and non-technical audiences in English

- Strong will to pursue a problem, identify the source, and propose possible solutions in collaboration with other team members in a timely manner

- A Bachelor or Master’s degree

- We recruit at different levels. For manager level and above, we would like you to have:

- at least 7 years of relevant project experience as well as

- having led a team

- demonstrating leadership skills, and ideally also

- some earlier involvement in the acquisition of new projects (business development).

**Preferred Qualifications**
- Experience of the full S/4 project lifecycle including estimating, planning, and delivering a solution end-to-end

- Nordic (Danish, Norwegian, Swedish or Finnish) language spoken

- An SAP certification in relevant area

- Ariba experience in addition to S/4 HANA configuration

- Deep business & industry experience in one or more industries

**Location**
 Stockholm, Gothenburg, Malmö
   

  

**Does this appeal to you?**
 If so, we really wish to hear from you! (We need people who can challenge conventional wisdom, offer unique perspectives, and contribute with innovative solutions.)
   

  

*If you are interested to learn more about Accenture´s recruitment process, great! We have gathered more info for you* 
*here.*
 Pleasenote that due to the summer season, our hiring process may be slower than usual. We apologize for any delay in responding to your applications. Rest assured, we are committed to reviewing each application thoroughly. We appreciate your patience during this time.

title: Director Consulting Services - SAP, Stockholm
description:
Beskrivning av tjänsten
   

  

 Vi växer och söker nu förstärkning av en säljande konsultchef till vår framgångsrika SAP-verksamhet i Stockholm! Hos oss blir du en del av ett kreativt och framgångsrikt team där det finns goda möjligheter att vidga nuvarande affär till nya kunder tack vara god lokal såväl som global kompetens.
   

  

 SAP-marknaden befinner sig i ett spännande läge med en snabb övergång till S/4HANA med fokus på molnbaserade lösningar, tillsammans med krav på verksamhetsoptimering och hållbarhet. Vill du spela en ledande roll i denna transformation?
   

  

 I rollen som Director Consulting Services (konsultchef) på CGI Stockholm blir du en del av både Stockholms och Sveriges SAP ledarteam, där vi utifrån kompetens och intresse har olika ansvarsområden. Vi har en öppen och generös företagskultur och att dela med sig av sin kunskap är en förutsättning för att vi tillsammans ska lyckas med att utveckla vår verksamhet. Vi som arbetar här är drivna och motiverade och för oss är balans i livet en självklarhet.
   

  

 Som konsultchef på CGI är du en viktig pusselbit i att utveckla våra kunder, team och kompetens framåt!
   

  

 Dina framtida arbetsuppgifter
   

  

 CGIs framgångsrika Proximity model är att du som konsultchef på CGI är både ledare och expert – det innebär att du är konsult samt leder konsulter framåt i ditt team.
   

  

 Som ledare kommer du att, tillsammans med andra konsultchefer, ha ansvar för tillväxt, kompetensutveckling och beläggning inom CGI Stockholms SAP-grupp. Vidare kommer du att ha resultat- och budgetansvar för dina kunder och även leda affärsutvecklingen såväl som att delta i kund- och marknadsrelaterade lokala aktiviteter. I rollen ingår även deltagande i kunddialoger samt att driva pre-sales relaterade aktiviteter inom området.
   

  

 Som SAP-expert kommer du att agera rådgivande och ledande i SAP-leveranser inom områden som SAP-arkitektur, lösningsdesign samt stötta våra kundleveranser.
   

  

 En framgångsrik konsultchef på CGI jobbar över tiden minst 50% som expert i fakturerande uppdrag.
   

  

 Kvalifikationer för att bli framgångsrik denna roll
   

  

 Vi söker dig som drivs av att utveckla affärer och relationer hos våra kunder. Du har god erfarenhet av att designa och föreslå SAP-lösningar baserat på S/4HANA, men även ytterligare molnlösningar från SAP, samt presentera lösningar och genomföra systemdemonstrationer för kunder. Du har även erfarenhet av att arbeta med SAPs olika licensmodeller. Som ledare motiverar och engagerar du dina medarbetare och som kollega bidrar du till vårt team genom din positiva energi.
   

  

 För att lyckas i rollen behöver du ha flera års erfarenhet inom SAP som produkt och god kännedom av SAP-marknaden i Sverige. Du har erfarenhet av försäljning och vi tycker att det är viktigt att du är affärsmässig och har förmågan att se kundnyttan. Vi tror att du har erfarenhet av en ledande roll med medarbetar- samt resultatansvar.
   

  

 Du behärskar svenska och engelska flytande i tal som väl i skift.
   

  

 Du erbjuds ett utmanande och stimulerande arbete med ansvar att driva din grupps såväl som enhetens utveckling framåt, tillsammans med ett fantastiskt gäng medarbetare och ledare.
   

  

 Klart DU vill bli en del av vårt team! Tveka inte att ta kontakt om du har några frågor, eller skicka in din ansökan redan idag, urval sker löpande.
   

  

 För frågor, vänligen kontakta rekryterande chef Carl Johan Pott på mail carljohan.pott@cgi.com eller på telefon 0722096386.
   

  

**Vad CGI erbjuder dig**
 CGIs kombination av global och lokal närvaro, med kontor på 30 orter i Sverige, ger nöjda kunder men innebär även att du som anställd alltid har ett kontor nära dig. Detta i kombination med flexibla arbetstider ger dig möjlighet till balans mellan privatliv och arbete, oavsett var i livet just du befinner dig.
   

  

 På CGI finns även stora möjligheter till interna karriärvägar där du kan välja att bli specialist inom ditt område, bredda dig inom nya områden eller ta en ledande befattning. Via våra interna nätverk, projekt och åtaganden i globala och nationella industrier, erbjuder vi dig kompetensutveckling och engagerade ledare som stöttar just dig i din utveckling.
   

  

 Mer information om våra förmåner:
   

  

* Aktieprogram och delägarskap: Som delägare har du möjlighet att påverka och i vårt aktieprogram matchar CGI ditt bidrag, krona för krona upp till 3% av din månadslön.
* Friskvårdsbidrag: Vi erbjuder ett årligt friskvårdsbidrag på 4000 kr.
* Föräldralön: Vi betalar upp till cirka 90% av din lön under den första tiden hemma.
* Trygg anställning: Våra konsulter anställs med kollektivavtal och försäkringar.
* Pensionslösningar: Vi erbjuder attraktiva och förmånliga pensionslösningar.
* Personalbil: Personalbilen används som en privatbil men leasas av CGI.


**Låt oss som ägare omvandla verklig insikt till handling – tillsammans.**
 Livet på CGI bygger på ägande, lagarbete, respekt och tillhörighet. Tillsammans med oss kommer du att kunna nå din fulla potential.
   

  

 Du är inbjuden att ta ägandeskap redan från första dagen i vårt arbete med att förverkliga vår dröm om att skapa en arbetsmiljö där vi trivs med att arbeta tillsammans och bidrar till framgången för vårt företag. Det är därför vi kallar oss CGI Partners snarare än anställda. Vi drar nytta av vår kollektiva framgång och tillsammans får vi möjlighet att aktivt forma vår företagsstrategi och inriktning.
   

  

 Ditt arbete skapar värde. Du kommer att vara med att utveckla innovativa lösningar och bygga relationer med medarbetare och kunder samtidigt som du får tillgång till globala möjligheter att skala upp dina idéer, omfamna nya möjligheter och dra nytta av gedigen bransch- och teknikexpertis.
   

  

 Du kommer att forma din karriär tillsammans med ett företag som är byggt för att växa och bestå. Du får stöd av ledare som bryr sig om din hälsa och ditt välbefinnande och ger dig möjligheter att fördjupa dina kunskaper och vidga dina vyer.
   

  

 Bli en del en av världens största leverantörer av IT- och affärskonsulttjänster.

title: Category Manager
description:
May 29, 2025
   

  

 Category Manager
   

  

**About Barilla**
 At Barilla, we believe that every great journey begins with passion and a bold vision. From our humble beginnings in 1877 in a small shop in Parma, Italy, we’ve blossomed into a global leader in the food industry, guided by our commitment to progress and excellence.
   

  

 Today, Barilla is an international group present in more than 100 countries and we are proud to be recognized as the world’s top food company by reputation. With 20 beloved brands in our portfolio, we are world leader for pasta, the number one choice for ready-made sauces in Europe, leader for bakery products in Italy, and for crispbread across Scandinavia with Wasa.
   

  

 Our success story is written by a passionate team of 9,000 dedicated employees across 30 plants and offices worldwide, all united by a shared mission to nourish the future with purpose and passion.
   

  

**Are you ready to add your unique flavor to our journey?**
**Job Description**
 Barilla is now looking for a full time Category Associate Manager to join the
 **Category team** 
 based in Stockholm Sweden.
   

  

 As our Category Manager, you will work together both with internal departments such as KAM, Trade, Finance and the Sales Force as well as with external customers as an expert to ensure that Barilla is seen as the preferred category partner, allowing the categories to grow. Furthermore, you will be the focal point of RGM and you will have the capability to influence the commercial teams as the sales navigator. You are comfortable in Nielsen and to Analyze market data at customer and category level. We also work with ICA Self Serve, so a plus if you have previous experience from this area.
   

  

 Key Accountabilities
   

  

**Data Analysis And Management**
* Analysis of data and insights management for shopper and category, converting into business recommendations and market/costumer opportunities.
* Continuously analyse our assortment in order to find opportunities for growth, come up with recommendations for our central customers as well as our sales force in order to drive profitable growth
* Prepare and present customer presentations to central customers


 Shopper and category intelligence
   

  

* Ensure shopper and category intelligence to answer relevant business questions
* Continuously observing/screening shopper/consumer/category trends and insights
* Recommend and execute category and shopper studies and present those to central customers as well as internal stakeholders


 Shelf layout and placement
   

  

 Develop and provide shelf placement guidelines and recommendations for improving shelf performance and product initiatives.
   

  

 Insights sharing and cross-functional collaboration
   

  

* Work closely with sales, trade marketing, category marketing and leverage key insights to drive sales and shares
* Hold engaging presentations of all category findings/analysis internally as well as during our Sales conferences to our Sales force
* Be the sparring partner and addressing queries related to ongoing projects and initiatives


**Desired Skills And Background**
* Great record of accomplishment, with a minimum of 5 years of work experience from category/brand management in the FMCG setting. Any additional experience in Sales and Trade Marketing will be considered a strong advantage
* Previous Experience in managing customer data driven decision making
* Excellent communication skills in Swedish and English
* Expert user of all Microsoft office tools as well as AC Nielsen databases or equivalent.
* Strong people management skills, by driving shared goals, building trust and using an open communication
* Demonstration of leadership and ownership, showing curiosity and creativity, while building strong and trustful relationships
* Project management and analytical skills with a strong “can do” attitude that allows sound decisions making within established guidelines
* International growth mindset, ideally proven with international experiences


 We Offer
   

  

* High Responsibility: From day one, we entrust you with significant responsibilities. Your impact matters, and we recognize it.
* Personal Development: Join us for professional growth and gain global experience in a dynamic international setting, offering extensive exposure and opportunities to excel.
* Continuous Learning: We believe in growth. Expect regular feedback and training opportunities to maximize your potential.
* Flexible Work Arrangements: Embrace our hybrid approach, and flexible working hours.
* Diversity & Inclusion: Engage in national and international projects that champion diversity and inclusion. Your unique perspective matters here.
* Excellent Public Transportation Access: Whether you prefer biking or public transport, we have got you covered. Enjoy working in a stylish, modern office which ensures easy access to various transportation options.
* Motivated Team: Be part of a dynamic and motivated team. We thrive on collaboration, innovation, and mutual support.
* Positive and Inclusive Culture: Experience a workplace where positivity and inclusivity are at the core. Our flat hierarchies encourage open communication and mutual respect.


 Application
   

  

 Candidates will be contacted by our international Recruiter at Talent Solutions, part of ManpowerGroup. Our Recruiter is based in Germany, for this reason, a number with the country code +49 will be used.
   

  

 Applications and CVs are sent via our job portal www.barillacareers.com Join us / Current Job Opportunities. If you have any questions regarding the recruitment process, please get in touch with Talent Acquisition, Kamil Tokarski; kamil.tokarski@external.barilla.com.
   

  

 We are reviewing candidates regularly so do not wait with your application!
   

  

 At Barilla, we are committed to creating an inclusive and equitable workplace where diversity in all its forms is valued and embraced. Our employment policies and practices are designed to ensure equal employment opportunities for all, regardless of age, race, color, citizenship, faith, religion, creed, gender, sex, pregnancy, gender identity or characteristics of expression, sexual orientation, marital status, genetic information, medical condition, protected veteran status, disability, or any other characteristic protected by law. Our commitment to equal employment stems from our unwavering belief that it is not only the right thing to do, but it is also a fundamental driver of innovation and business success.
   

  

 Trade Marketing & Sales
   

  

 Sweden
   

  

 Stockholm
   

  

 Permanent

title: Manager Equipment Service (m/f/d)
description:
**The Opportunity**
**The Opportunity**
 Are you a driven, commercially minded leader ready to take on a pivotal role in a dynamic, high-growth environment? At Avantor, we're looking for a
 **Manager Equipment Services** 
 to lead our Technical Services operations across Sweden. Based in Stockholm, you'll report directly to the Director ES Region North and take ownership of driving growth, optimizing service delivery, and developing a high-performing team. This is your chance to lead from the front—implementing best practices, enhancing quality standards, and aligning operations with strategic sales priorities in a business where innovation and service excellence are at the core.
   

  

**What We Are Looking For**
 You are an experienced people leader with a proven track record in technical services and an instinct for commercial success. You have the ability to balance strategic thinking with operational execution and are confident making data-informed decisions in fast-paced, target-driven environments.
   

  

**To Succeed, You Will Need**
* Strong leadership experience in managing technical and administrative teams
* Proven knowledge of technical service environments, ideally with ISO 9001 or ISO 17025 familiarity
* High-level influencing skills and collaborative mindset
* Solid understanding of financial models including labor cost control and third-party service use
* Fluency in both English and Swedish, with a valid driving license
* Ability to work from the Stockholm office 3 days/week, with travel across Sweden


**How You Will Thrive And Make An Impact**
 At Avantor, your leadership will directly influence our success in Sweden. You’ll:
   

  

* Drive profitability by optimizing resources, refining service methodologies, and adopting ABS/TDM tools
* Strengthen collaboration between technical and commercial teams to align service delivery with business goals
* Implement SOPs and elevate quality through best-in-class practices
* Develop your team through mentoring, succession planning, and creating a strong safety culture
* Actively participate in the local leadership team, helping shape the broader strategic direction You’ll manage a team of 5 field-based professionals across Stockholm, Gothenburg, and South Sweden—empowering them to excel while making a measurable difference for our customers and our business.


**Ready to shape the future of technical services with Avantor?** 
 Join us and help deliver mission-critical support that powers science—and fuels progress.
   

  

**Disclaimer**
 The above statements are intended to describe the general nature and level of work being performed by employees assigned to this classification. They are not intended to be construed as an exhaustive list of all responsibilities, duties and skills required of employees assigned to this position. Avantor is proud to be an equal opportunity employer.
   

  

**Why Avantor?**
**Dare to go further in your career.** 
 Join our global team of 14,000+ associates whose passion for discovery and determination to overcome challenges relentlessly advances life-changing science.
   

  

**The work we do changes people's lives for the better.** 
 It brings new patient treatments and therapies to market, giving a cancer survivor the chance to walk his daughter down the aisle. It enables medical devices that help a little boy hear his mom's voice for the first time. Outcomes such as these create unlimited opportunities for you to contribute your talents, learn new skills and grow your career at Avantor.
   

  

 We are committed to helping you on this journey through our diverse, equitable and inclusive culture which includes learning experiences to support your career growth and success. At Avantor, dare to go further and see how the impact of your contributions set science in motion to create a better world.
 **Apply today!**
**EEO Statement**
 We are an Equal Employment/Affirmative Action employer and VEVRAA Federal Contractor. We do not discriminate in hiring on the basis of sex, gender identity, sexual orientation, race, color, religious creed, national origin, physical or mental disability, protected Veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state/province, or local law.
   

  

 If you need a reasonable accommodation for any part of the employment process, please contact us by email at recruiting@avantorsciences.com and let us know the nature of your request and your contact information. Requests for accommodation will be considered on a case-by-case basis. Please note that only inquiries concerning a request for reasonable accommodation will be responded to from this email address.
   

  

**Privacy Policy**
 We will use the personal information that you have submitted to us in order to consider your application for the relevant role.
   

  

 Your privacy is important to us. Please click here for our Privacy Policy which explains the purposes for which we will use your personal information and the ways in which we will handle and retain your information. It also explains the rights you have in relation to your information, and how to contact us with any queries or requests.
   

  

**3rd Party Non-Solicitation Policy**
 By submitting candidates without having been formally assigned on and contracted for a specific job requisition by Avantor, or by failing to comply with the Avantor recruitment process, you forfeit any fee on the submitted candidates, regardless of your usual terms and conditions. Avantor works with a preferred supplier list and will take the initiative to engage with recruitment agencies based on its needs and will not be accepting any form of solicitation.

title: Strategic Account Advisor
company_industry: Software Development, IT Services and IT Consulting, and Technology, Information and Internet
description:
*To get the best candidate experience, please consider applying for a maximum of 3 roles within 12 months to ensure you are not duplicating efforts.*
 Job Category
   

  

 Sales
   

  

 Job Details
   

  

**About Salesforce**
 We’re Salesforce, the Customer Company, inspiring the future of business with AI+ Data +CRM. Leading with our core values, we help companies across every industry blaze new trails and connect with customers in a whole new way. And, we empower you to be a Trailblazer, too — driving your performance and career growth, charting new paths, and improving the state of the world. If you believe in business as the greatest platform for change and in companies doing well and doing good – you’ve come to the right place.
   

  

 This is a unique opportunity to join a team of ex- Top Tier Strategy Consultants, working as a SWAT team for the Northern Europe CEO. Salesforce is looking for very hardworking and passionate individuals to be based in Sweden who can effectively articulate how & why our solutions can help transform Customers’ business and exceed their goals!
   

  

 Salesforce is aspiring to deliver business transformation enabled by technology to its customers and therefore requires individuals able to develop deep insight into the business dynamics of large, sophisticated enterprises and help shape customers change agenda.
   

  

 This role is an exciting blend of frontline commercial execution and long-term strategic thinking.
   

  

 You will work with our Enterprise sales teams on the biggest and most important sales opportunities in across the Nordics and Benelux, engaging with C-level customers and providing structure, insight, and leadership to help sales teams drive opportunities over the finish line. Specifically, this role is passionate about definition of Account Strategies, delivery of C-Level value propositions, investment justifications and development of sophisticated deal structures and commercial proposals for large deals.
   

  

**Responsibilities**
* Work with Enterprise sales teams to define the commercial strategy; prioritise sales initiatives based on problems, value creation potential, and customers’ strategic priorities
* Build and deliver compelling Investment Justifications to secure Customers’ funding for Salesforce solutions. Work closely with account teams and customers to identify, analyse key business value drivers
* Articulate how our solutions will digitally transform customers’ businesses at scale
* Put together attractive deal structures and articulate the value of our Proposals
* Create and deliver C- level compelling propositions as basis for strategic technology decisions


**Experience & Skills**
* Required experience in a Top -Tier Strategy Consulting Firm
* Role seniority determined by experience levels
* Strong analytical & problem solving skills essential
* Strong ability to create, quantify insights and communicate recommendations to CxOs
* Strong influencing capabilities; must be a self-starter, high energy
* Strong inclination to Technology & Enterprise Software industry
* Strong appetite to work in a consultative strategic selling environment.
* MBA degree
* For this role, it is essential that candidates are proficient in Swedish.


 Accommodations
   

  

 If you require assistance due to a disability applying for open positions please submit a request via this Accommodations Request Form.
   

  

 Posting Statement
   

  

 Salesforce is an equal opportunity employer and maintains a policy of non-discrimination with all employees and applicants for employment. What does that mean exactly? It means that at Salesforce, we believe in equality for all. And we believe we can lead the path to equality in part by creating a workplace that’s inclusive, and free from discrimination. Know your rights: workplace discrimination is illegal. Any employee or potential employee will be assessed on the basis of merit, competence and qualifications – without regard to race, religion, color, national origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender expression or identity, transgender status, age, disability, veteran or marital status, political viewpoint, or other classifications protected by law. This policy applies to current and prospective employees, no matter where they are in their Salesforce employment journey. It also applies to recruiting, hiring, job assignment, compensation, promotion, benefits, training, assessment of job performance, discipline, termination, and everything in between. Recruiting, hiring, and promotion decisions at Salesforce are fair and based on merit. The same goes for compensation, benefits, promotions, transfers, reduction in workforce, recall, training, and education.

title: Researcher Standardization
description:
**Join our Team**
**About this opportunity:**
 We are expanding the Radio & Spectrum standardization team in our Standards & Technology organization. At Standards & Technology we are part of Ericsson Business Unit Networks to ensure technology leadership in 5G and beyond Radio Access Networks (RAN) by actively driving standardization, regulation, new architectures, concepts, and testbeds including SW- and HW research. This position is in the area of 3GPP standardization and provides the opportunity to work in a team that is focused on physical layer, radio, and spectrum standardization.
 *You will be offered the opportunity to be part of the world’s leading RAN standardization team at an exciting time, just when we are about to start defining 6G. You will be given the opportunity to contribute to shaping Ericsson’s 6G vision and bring it to life first in 3GPP and later see it take off in actual products. The person joining us will work with 5G and 6G standardization towards 3GPP RAN4. The focus will be on BS RF aspects including performance and requirements in 5G Advanced and 6G. In our team you will work with very experienced colleagues and will be offered the opportunity to learn from the best. At BNEW ST standardization, research and product development go hand and hand and we encourage our people to explore these domains to grow competence and a career in Ericsson.*
**What you will do:**
* Work in an international team of world-class standardization colleagues and researchers with different backgrounds and experiences in developing novel solutions and concepts for future mobile networks
* Develop Research strategies, actively participate and drive standardization, more specifically develop and drive requirements for 5G evolution and new 6G features towards 3GPP RAN4
* In collaboration with colleagues, perform research, generate simulation results, protect novel concepts through invention disclosures and provide written contributions in the area of 3GPP
* RAN4 standards
* Evaluate internal and external standardization proposals, and coordinate our view with internal stakeholders from research, development and product teams
* Manage and contribute to industry-related interactions and engagements within Ericsson including product lines, development units, customer units, and ecosystem partners
* Communicate results, a very important aspect of the work we do!


**The skills you bring:**
* PhD, MSc. degree or equivalent, in Electrical or Computer Engineering or related. Preferably with a specialization towards radio and physical layer aspects of wireless communication
* Excellent knowledge of mobile networks and industry with strong background in radio communication and signal processing
* Competence in BS RF transmitter and receiver requirements (conducted and radiated), RF front-end, antenna, radio spectrum and microwave circuit design
* Proficient L1/L2/L3 knowledge is needed to understand the dependencies between the radio, PHY and higher layers in the 3GPP protocol stack
* Good understanding of 3GPP device and/or network equipment implementations
* Excellent analytical thinking with a high ability to understand and drive technical conceptual proposals and solutions
* Hands-on simulation skills, at least on link level
* Comfortable with speaking in public, participating in discussions and technical debates
* Endurance to cope with extended periods (2-3 weeks) of high workload
* The ability to re-energize in between extended periods of high workload


**Nice to have:**
* Experience from 3GPP meeting attendance is a considerable plus
* At least basic experience in working with IPRs
* Experience in system level and protocol simulations


**Why join Ericsson?**
 At Ericsson, you´ll have an outstanding opportunity. The chance to use your skills and imagination to push the boundaries of what´s possible. To build solutions never seen before to some of the world’s toughest problems. You´ll be challenged, but you won’t be alone. You´ll be joining a team of diverse innovators, all driven to go beyond the status quo to craft what comes next.
   

  

**What happens once you apply?**
 Click Here to find all you need to know about what our typical hiring process looks like.
   

  

 Encouraging a diverse and inclusive organization is core to our values at Ericsson, that's why we champion it in everything we do. We truly believe that by collaborating with people with different experiences we drive innovation, which is essential for our future growth. We encourage people from all backgrounds to apply and realize their full potential as part of our Ericsson team. Ericsson is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer. learn more.
   

  

**Primary country and city:** 
 Sweden (SE) || Stockholm
   

  

**Req ID:** 
 767462

title: Site Engineer
description:
**Job Description**
*(For English, please see below)*
*Den ökande efterfrågan på IT-infrastruktur är tydligt, vårt Stockholms campus och våra datacenter är strategiskt placerade för att möta behovet av affärskritiskt IT-infrastruktur. Vi är en ledande leverantör när det gäller datacenter tjänster över hela EMEA. Nu söker vi en Site Engineer till teamet. Har du teknisk erfarenhet av kritisk infrastruktur, ett öga för detaljer och är en serviceinriktad person? Då är detta ett guldläge för dig! Här blir du en del av ett globalt företag inom en snabbväxande sektor.*
**Din roll**
 Digital Realty Är Ett Företag Som Förstår Vikten Av Att Hålla Den Affärskritiska Infrastrukturen i Gång På Ett Säkert Sätt. Inom Vår Site Team Ser Vi Till Att Allt i Våra Datacenters Fungerar Felfritt. Vår Infrastruktur Består Av Dieselgeneratorer, Kylsystem, UPS-enheter, Brandskyddssystem Och Mycket Mera. För Att Kunna Arbeta På Ett Säkert Och Effektivt Sätt, Är Det Av Yttersta Vikt Att Ha En Förståelse För Datacenterinfrastruktur Samt Att Samarbeta Med Både Det Egna Teamet Samt Andra Team. Som Site Engineer Kommer Du Att Vara En Viktig Del Av Detta Arbete. Du Ges Möjlighet Till Att Utveckla Dina Tekniska Färdigheter När Vi Fortsätter Att Implementera Nya Datacenters Runt Om i Europa. Du Kommer Att Få Kombinera Din Tekniska Färdighet Tillsammans Med En Proaktiv Inställning För Att Kunna Lösa Problem Och Driva Verksamheten Framåt. I Rollen Ingår Följande Uppgifter
   

  

* Utföra daglig övervakning av byggnad samt utrustning och rapportera uppkommande brister.
* Supportera vid underhåll, reparationer av byggnad och utrustning i enlighet med rutiner, förfrågningar, ritningar, Method of Procedure (MOP), och Service Level Agreement (SLA's).
* Svara på larm samt hantera dessa enligt riktlinjer.
* Tillhandahålla praktisk vägledning för extern säkerhetspersonal.
* Övervaka utrustningsprestanda och installationer.
* Tillhandahålla information om energianvändning och kapacitetsplanering, samt data för inmatning i rapporter t.ex. elmätardata.
* Upprätthålla kommunikation med entreprenörer och följa upp eventuella problem.
* Supportera driftsättning av utrustning och system, samt dokumentera.


**Vi söker dig som**
 Har förmågan att anpassa sig till system och kan få en överblick och förstå komplexa inställningar. Vi tror dessutom att du tidigare arbetat i en miljö där kvalitet och säkerhet har stått högt på agendan. Som person bör du vara detaljfokuserad, ha en problemlösande inställning och klara av att möta deadlines och förväntningar på kvalité. I denna position kommer du arbeta nära kunder, leverantörer och kollegor, så det är bra om du är en person som är utåtriktad och serviceinriktad.
   

  

 För att lösa de tekniska sidorna av detta jobb så behöver du:
   

  

* Några års arbetslivserfarenhet från liknande roll.
* Utbildning som mekaniskingenjör, mariningenjör, elektriker eller liknande.
* Kunskap av system för elförsörjning och klimatkontroll.
* Erfarenhet av att underhålla generatorer och kylare.
* Goda datorkunskaper .


 I tjänsten som Site Engineer arbetar du primärt under kontorstider men i rollen ingår också vissa veckor av beredskapstid. Vi ser därför att du har körkort, tillgång till bil och bor inom 1 timmes radie från vårt campus, som ligger i Kista. Då vi är en internationell verksamhet är det därför en nödvändighet med en god kommunikationsförmåga på svenska samt engelska, muntligt och skriftligt.
   

  

**Om oss**
 Digital Realty förenar företag och data genom att tillhandahålla ett komplett utbud av lösningar för datacenter, colocation och interconnection. PlatformDIGITAL®, företagets globala datacenterplattform, ger kunderna en säker mötesplats för data och en beprövad lösningsmetod Pervasive Datacenter Architecture (PDx®) för att driva innovation och effektivt hantera utmaningar med Data Gravity. Digital Realty ger sina kunder tillgång till de datacommunities som är viktiga för dem med ett globalt datacenternätverk med över 300 datacenter i mer än 50 storstäder i 28 länder på sex kontinenter.
   

  

**Vad vi har att erbjuda**
 Vår snabbt föränderliga affärssektor erbjuder möjligheten att vara en del av ett drivet och engagerat team som arbetar tillsammans för att förstå och möta de föränderliga behoven hos våra globala kunder. Kom med och bli en del av en stödjande och öppen miljö där du kan ta med hela dig själv till jobbet. Som en del av vårt team får du arbeta med människor från olika affärsområden, utmana vårt sätt att göra saker och omsätta dina idéer i handling. Vi ger dig också massor av utvecklingsmöjligheter så att du kan bygga upp en givande och framgångsrik karriär hos oss.
   

  

 Detta är en spännande tid att bli en del av vårt företag, så ansök nu och sätt din prägel på vår framtid. Tjänsten är en tillsvidare anställning placerad på Digital´s kontor i Akalla, Stockholm.
   

  

 \_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_
   

  

*The increasing demand for IT infrastructure is clear, our Stockholm campus and data centres are strategically located to meet the need for business-critical IT infrastructure. We are a leading provider of data center services across EMEA. We are now looking for a Site Engineer to join the team. Do you have technical experience of critical infrastructure, an eye for detail and are a service orientated person? Then this is a golden opportunity for you! Here you will be part of a global company in a fast-growing sector.*
**Your role**
 Digital Realty is a company that understands the importance of keeping business-critical infrastructure running safely. Our Site team play a key role, ensuring everything in our data centres operates as it should for our customers. Our infrastructure consists of diesel generators, chillers, UPS, fire suppression systems and much more. It’s about understanding the importance of our data centre infrastructure and working closely with other teams across the business to maintain it effectively. This means you’ll be involved in a variety of tasks, with plenty of opportunities to develop your technical skills further as we continue to bring new data centres online across Europe.
   

  

**Role**
 You’ll combine technical versatility with a proactive approach to solving problems and finding solutions. The role includes the following tasks:
   

  

* Execute day-to-day monitoring of buildings and equipment, and report all building and customer defects.
* Support in the maintenance and repairs on buildings and equipment in accordance with routines, change requests, drawings, Method of Procedure (MOP) and Service Level Agreement (SLA's).
* Respond to alarms and manage them according to guidelines.
* Provide practical guidance to external security personnel.
* Monitors performance of equipment and installations and co-provides input on power usage and capacity planning. Provides data for input into reports, such as electric meter data.
* Maintain communication with contractors and track any issues.
* Support commissioning activities for equipment and systems with focus on documentation.


**What You’ll Need**
 We’re looking for someone who adapts to systems easily and are able to get an overview and understand complex settings. Someone who is used to work in an environment where quality and security is key. You need to be attentive of details, have a problem-solving approach and great at meeting deadlines and quality expectations. In this position you’ll be working closely with customers, suppliers and colleagues, so an outgoing and service-minded personality is key.
   

  

 To be able to solve the technical aspects of the job you’ll need:
   

  

* Preferably 3-5 years of experience as Technical Engineer in data center infrastructure or location with similar infrastructure.
* Education as Electrician, Electrical or Mechanical Engineer, Marine Engineer or similar.
* In-depth knowledge of electrical power supply and climate control systems.
* Experience with generator and chiller maintenance.
* Strong computer skills.


 In the position as Site Engineer, you work primarily during office hours, but the role also includes certain weeks of standby time. We therefore see that you have a driving license, access to a car and live within 1 hour of our site.
   

  

 Since we are an international company it´s necessary that you have good communication skills in Swedish and English, verbally and in writing.
   

  

**What We Can Offer You**
 Our rapidly evolving business sector offers the opportunity to be part of a courageous and passionate team who work together to understand and meet the changing needs of our global customers. Join us and you’ll be part of a supportive and inclusive environment where you can bring your whole self to work. As part of our team, you’ll get to work with people from different business areas, challenge the way we do things and put your ideas into action. We’ll also give you plenty of development opportunities so you can build a rewarding and successful career with us.
   

  

**About Us**
 Digital Realty brings companies and data together by delivering the full spectrum of data center, colocation and interconnection solutions. PlatformDIGITAL®, the company’s global data center platform, provides customers with a secure data meeting place and a proven Pervasive Datacenter Architecture (PDx®) solution methodology for powering innovation and efficiently managing Data Gravity challenges. Digital Realty gives its customers access to the connected data communities that matter to them with a global data center footprint of 300+ facilities in 50+ metros across 25+ countries on six continents.
   

  

**Apply**
 Interested in this role? We’re growing fast, so this is a great time to join us and make your mark on our future. The position is a permanent position with employment at Digital's office in Akalla, Stockholm.

title: Senior Backend Engineer
description:
About us:
   

  

 Legora is working to empower lawyers and automate legal work. Our approach is to enable the lawyer of the future: a human-AI lawyer who's an order of magnitude more effective than a team of conventional legal professionals. The human-AI lawyer will iterate at the speed of their judgment, even in the most complex legal scenarios, and will out-smart and out-deliver the best pure AI system.
   

  

 You are joining an early-stage scale-up with exceptional product-market fit that thousands of lawyers use daily at global institutions such as Bird&Bird, Mannheimer Swartling, and Heineken. Backed by $35M+ in funding from top investors like Benchmark, Redpoint, and Y Combinator, Legora is a group of exceptional engineers, lawyers, and doers. Here, you will have infinite room to grow and rethink how truly worthwhile work gets done.
   

  

**The role:**
 As a Backend Engineer at Legora you will build, review and ship amazing products helping legal professionals all over the world in their day-to-day job. You’ll get the chance to work across the entire tech stack with clear ownership and autonomy.
   

  

 What you will be doing:
   

  

* Architect and implement features for our web platform
* Take ownership of our codebase, balancing high-quality code, security and speed of development
* Work with technologies such as Node.js, Python, Postgres, Elasticsearch, AWS, Azure and Kubernetes
* Review code and mentor junior colleagues to support them in their development, making the team even better!
* Drive continuous improvement and challenge us, the industry and yourself


 Who you are:
   

  

* A passionate engineer with several years of experience building great products using cutting-edge technologies
* You feel comfortable working across the entire tech stack, with focus on backend development
* You’re autonomous and take pride in the code you write
* You’re a problem solver who’s not afraid to come up with creative solutions and think holistically about software architecture
* Experience in infrastructure and integrations are a big plus


 What’s in it for you:
   

  

* Career development opportunities in a rapidly evolving entrepreneurial environment.
* Direct collaboration with senior leadership and the opportunity to directly impact company growth and strategy.
* A collaborative, high-energy team environment where your ideas and contributions are valued and implemented.
* Competitive salary complemented with a transparent and highly competitive options program.
* Centrally located offices in Stockholm, London, and NYC, designed as a space for you to do your life's work.


 We founded Legora with the vision of giving lawyers the tools they deserve.
   

  

 We didn't build Legora for how law is practiced today; we built it for how it should be practiced tomorrow.

title: Senior Backend Engineer
description:
**Join our global force of 500+ innovators, blending the latest in tech with the greatest in soundtracking, from our Stockholm HQ to offices in London, New York, Los Angeles, Berlin, Oslo, and Seoul. We’re an industry leader with a startup mentality. We take what we do seriously, but we don’t take ourselves too seriously. Creating and collaborating to transform the sound of streaming, content, and culture. Come join us— and let the world feel your work.**
**How You Will Make An Impact**
 As a Senior Software Engineer in the Customer Platform team, you’ll own and evolve the systems that define how users interact with Epidemic Sound — including account management and entitlements across both individual creators and enterprise customers. We’re the system of record for account structures and what users are entitled to, ensuring the right experience reaches the right person, whether it's a solo artist or a global creative team.
   

  

 This foundational work enables us to deliver flexible, scalable experiences and underpins many of our commercial and product initiatives. You’ll have the opportunity to contribute to a high-impact platform with visibility across the organization — shaping how we deliver enterprise-quality features and scale our offerings.
   

  

 We also foster a strong engineering culture grounded in openness and collaboration. You will regularly engage in pair and mob programming, as well as dedicated hack weeks for experimentation and learning. If you enjoy knowledge sharing and shaping a team’s direction in a fast-moving environment, you’ll feel right at home here.
   

  

**Your role will include, but not be limited to:**
* Design, build, and maintain scalable backend services primarily in Golang on Google Cloud Platform (GCP)
* Champion technical excellence from system design and architecture through development, deployment, reliability, and security.
* Collaborate closely with frontend developers to deliver seamless React/Next.js-based interfaces for managing accounts.
* Partner closely with enterprise, commercial, and product teams to define requirements, prioritize features, and shape the product roadmap.
* Clearly communicate technical plans, challenges, and solutions to both technical and non-technical stakeholders.


**Our Tech stack:**
 We’re evolving our platform toward modern backend technologies, primarily using:
   

  

* Golang (our core backend language)
* Google Cloud Platform (GCP)
* Kubernetes and Docker
* GitHub and GitHub Actions for version control and CI/CD
* Grafana for monitoring and observability
